folder: Morton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Georgian doorway, rated the most beautiful in New York, at 59 Morton Street, built by A.T. Stewart, on the north side of Morton, east of Hudson Street.

About 1918

New York Sun Staff Photograph
Gift of E. M. Jenks

folder: Morton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Morton Street, east from Hudson Street, showing the bend which marks the eastern end of the original Morton Street and the western end of the former Ardens Street, a much narrower Street which was amalgamated with Morton Street in 1829. The little gap between Nos. 46 and 44, where the bend occurs on the south side of the street, exactly marks the eastern boundary line of the old Trinity Church Farm. No. 44 is a three-story house adjoining the three five-story tenements 42-40-38 Morton Street.
June 3, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view three years later, but not including Hudson Street. Nos. 61 and 59 are the two small houses on the north side adjoining a new apartment building, which is only slightly visible here, at 438 Hudson Street on the N.E. corner (and including 67-63 Morton Street).
April 3, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

Neg: 2786 - Both of above views on same negative.

folder: Hudson Street and Morton Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 34, at the N.E. corner of Hudson Street and St. Luke's Place (Leroy Street in the block east of Hudson).

P. L. Sperr.

November 30, 1933.

(2)
No. 35. An intrepid vaquero and his big sister, at 427 Hudson Street, between Leroy and Morton Streets. The east side of Hudson Street, at Morton, is shown in the background.

P. L. Sperr.

November 30, 1933.

(3)
No. 36. A group of urchins on the S.W. corner of Hudson and Morton Streets.

P. L. Sperr.

November 30, 1933.
title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.34-36.

folder: Hudson Street & Morton Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Hudson Street, west side, south from, but not including Morton Street. Also shown is Leroy Street,(across clearance) at the S.W. corner of Hudson Street.
March 28, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Morton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Morton Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Hudson Street, as seen across clearance on the west side of Hudson Street. Also shown (right side), is Hudson Street, east side, north from Morton Street.

March 28, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, and showing a more extensive view of Hudson Street.

March 28, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
